meanings.definition: To add subtle distinctions or variations to something.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys nuancing her paintings with different shades of blue.
meanings.sent2: He is nuancing his argument by considering various perspectives.
meanings.sent3: The chef was nuancing the flavor of the soup with a pinch of exotic spices.
meanings.sent4: Her storytelling skill involves nuancing each character's personality like a skilled painter.
meanings.sent5: The musician was nuancing the melody with delicate notes, creating a beautiful composition.

meanings.definition: To give more detail or complexity to a statement or idea.
meanings.sent1: They are nuancing their research findings to provide a comprehensive analysis.
meanings.sent2: The author is nuancing the plot of the novel to make it more engaging.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was nuancing his joke with unexpected twists, making the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was nuancing the concept of freedom like a master weaver crafting an intricate tapestry.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was nuancing the lesson with real-life examples, helping the students understand better.
